A fellow student sends you the following information:

I have calculated price elasticity based on the following data, but my lecturer says it is wrong. He did not explain why. Can you help me?

The price increased from R10 to R20, (10/10 = 100% increase in price).

Qd decreased from 10 to 5 units (5/10 = 50% decline in quantity).

Surely, this would give a price elasticity of 0,5 (50%/100% = 0,5)?

What would your response to this student be?
